citation.article-title: Kineococcus rhizosphaerae sp. nov., isolated from rhizosphere soil
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Kineococcus rhizosphaerae sp. nov.

Kineococcus rhizosphaerae (rhi.zo.sphae′rae. Gr. fem. n. rhiza a root; L. fem. n. sphaera ball, sphere; N.L. gen. fem. n. rhizosphaerae of the rhizosphere, referring to the site from which the type strain was isolated).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-positive-staining, non-spore-forming, oxidase-negative, catalase-positive, motile cocci.
Colonies are circular, smooth and orange.
Grows in the presence of 5 % (w/v) NaCl.
Hydrolyses aesculin but not casein, chitin, cellulose, elastin or starch.
Positive for β-galactosidase but negative for glucose fermentation, nitrate reduction, and degradation of hypoxanthine, dl-tyrosine and xanthine.
Utilizes l-arabinose, dextran, d-fructose, d-galactose, d-glucose and melibiose as sole carbon sources.
Does not utilize d-dulcitol, meso-erythritol, glycerol, myo-inositol, d-mannitol, l-rhamnose, d-ribose, salicin, d-sorbitol, l-sorbose or d-xylitol.
Acetate, benzoate, formate, dl-malate, succinate and l-tartrate are not assimilated.
meso-Diaminopimelic acid is the diagnostic diamino acid of the peptidoglycan.
Whole-cell hydrolysates contain arabinose, galactose and xylose as characteristic sugars.
The polar lipids comprise diphosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylglycerol, phosphatidylinositol and two unknown phospholipids.
The major cellular fatty acid is anteiso-C15 : 0 (72.5 % of the total in the type strain).
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 73.8 mol%.
The type strain, RP-B16T (=KCTC 19366T =DSM 19711T), was isolated from rhizosphere soil of a cliff-associated plant (Peucedanum japonicum Thunb.) on Mara Island, Jeju, Republic of Korea.
